Paul bunnel test is used for
Pharyngitis is most often caused by
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Common viral causes of pharyngitis include:
  • • Rhinovirus (most frequent cause) Adenovirus Influenza virus Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) (causes infectious mononucleosis) Coronavirus Coxsackievirus Viral pharyngitis symptoms:
  • • Gradual onset of sore throat Low-grade fever Cough, rhinorrhea, and conjunctivitis (suggesting a viral cause) Absence of exudates on tonsils (except in EBV infection) Treatment:
  • • Supportive care (rest, hydration, analgesics like paracetamol, and throat lozenges). No antibiotics are needed unless a bacterial infection is suspected. Explanation of Incorrect Options: (B) Pneumococcus – Incorrect Streptococcus pneumoniae (Pneumococcus) is not a common cause of pharyngitis. It primarily causes pneumonia, meningitis, otitis media, and sinusitis. (C) Streptococcus – Incorrect (but an important bacterial cause) Group A Streptococcus (Streptococcus pyogenes) is the most common bacterial cause of pharyngitis, but bacterial pharyngitis occurs in only 10-30% of cases, making viruses the more common cause overall. Strep throat symptoms (bacterial pharyngitis): Sudden onset of sore throat Fever > 38°C Tonsillar exudates Tender anterior cervical lymphadenopathy Absence of cough (suggests bacterial origin) While important, it accounts for fewer cases than viral causes. Rapid strep tests and throat cultures help differentiate it from viral pharyngitis. (D) Corynebacterium – Incorrect Corynebacterium diphtheriae causes diphtheria, which can present with pharyngitis, but it is rare due to widespread vaccination (DPT/DTaP vaccine). Diphtheria features: Pseudomembrane formation in the throat Bull neck appearance due to lymphadenopathy Toxin-mediated complications (myocarditis, neuropathy) Diphtheria is NOT the most common cause of pharyngitis.

A 20year old female presented to her physician with a low grade fever, headache, and painfulgenital lesions. Culture detects herpes simplex virus. Which of the following statements bestdescribes infection with this common human pathogen?

options.label: A
options.text: Infection with type I virus is most common

options.label: B
options.text: Initial infection usually occurs by intestinal absorption of virus

options.label: C
options.text: It can be reactivated by emotional disturbances or prolonged exposure to sunlight

options.label: D
options.text: It rarely recurs in host who has high antibody titer

options.label: E
options.text: The CNS and visceral organs are usually involved

questions.correct_answer: C. It can be reactivated by emotional disturbances or prolonged exposure to sunlight
